DOC.brief_summary: H0 hypothesis: IV dexketoprofen is equivalent to placebo in ceasing migraine attack in emergency department. H1 hypothesis: IV dexketoprofen is not equivalent (superior) to placebo in ceasing migraine attack in emergency department.
DOC.brief_title: IV Dexketoprofen vs Placebo in Migranie Attack
DOC.detailed_description: Migraine attack is one of the most leading causes presentations to emergency department. Patients with migraine attack seek urgent care to cease their pain. There are so many interventions defined in the medical literature that can be used in migraine attacks. However, as a IV drug, dexketoprofen; little known whether IV dexketoprofen is superior to placebo or not. In the present study we aimed to determine the effects of IV dexketoprofen in migraine attack in emergency department.
DOC.criteria: patients presented with headache who diagnosed as migraine attack according to the international headache society denied to give inform concent, illiterate patients, chronic renal failure, taking NSAIDs during the last six hours, pregnancy
